result.execSummary:
The defendant Curtis Brewer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Misappropriate ID Info - Obtain Money, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.201(2)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court
Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program.
The same Conditions for Extended Supervision apply as to Conditions for Probation if revoked.
Court will allow transfer to Milwaukee County.

miscConds.notes:
Restitution of $138.52 (payable to North Shore Bank) is to be paid within the first year of probation as a Condition of Probation.

  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
Court costs ($268) and DNA surcharge ($250) are to be paid as a Condition of Probation.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.

No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
No contact with the victim or victim's residence listed in the Criminal Complaint.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

timeConds.notes:
Non-working Hours (Huber) - with Standard Release Conditions.
STAYED.
To be used at Agent's discretion.

records.addlTxt:
Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Curtis Brewer in court with attorney Joseph Smith. 

State presented their sentencing recommendations.
Defense presented their sentencing recommendations.



Court orders the following:
Count 1:
Total Prison:  3.5 Years.
Initial Confinement:  1.5 Years.
Extended Supervision: 2.0 Years.
STAYED.

IF REVOKED:
Defendant is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for Substance Abuse Program.

Term of Probation: 2.5 Years.
Concurrent to:  Jefferson County Case 14CF89.
Court will allow transfer to Milwaukee County.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
No Use or Possession of a controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No contact with: victim or victim's residence listed in the criminal complaint.
DNA Sample (if not already provided).
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.

RESTITUTION:  $138.52  (to be paid to North Shore Bank - restitution to be paid within the first year of probation).
Costs:  $268
DNA Sample (if not already provided) and SURCHARGE:  $250
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.

CONDITION TIME: 
60 Days in the Waukesha County Jail w/huber (all standard release conditions)
STAYED.    To be used at agent's discretion.  

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
(2) Character Letters, received and filed in court by Atty. Smith.
Sentencing hearing on May 18, 2015 at 11:00 am.
